channel.title: Small Problem with Client - With Picture
channel.description:
I downloaded a source, and a client but when i start the client it always has the source name at the top.
How do i change it so it says the name of my server and not the client..?
[img]http://img153.imageshack.us/img153/9715/titleay1.png[/img]

item.title: Small Problem with Client - With Picture
item.dc:creator: @f1rey_wav3 f1rey wav3
item.description:
@f1rey_wav3 wrote:

No try this

Change whats in your run.bat to this

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Ic3barrag3scape Client
color 0a
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
PAUSE

Thats what i have for mine

Change ic3barrag3scape to your server’s name see if it works.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 22, 2009, 12:43:47 pm[/size][hr]I know you didnt surf, it would have renamed the title of the window you were talking about

Thats what it does for me…

It would have done the job, because the title is what is going to be the title of the window it opens, not the run.bat

Read full topic
item.source: Small Problem with Client - With Picture

item.title: Small Problem with Client - With Picture
item.dc:creator: @Surfr Surfr
item.description:
@Surfr wrote:

searched every editable file in the source and nothing.

I’m out of luck?

F1rey, you misunderstand my problem, i don’t want to rename run.bat.

Problem Solved

Thanks, Dark. I manually looked through GUI and found what i was looking for.

Read full topic
item.source: Small Problem with Client - With Picture

item.title: Small Problem with Client - With Picture
item.dc:creator: @f1rey_wav3 f1rey wav3
item.description:
@f1rey_wav3 wrote:

Right click on your run.bat and hit edit

There should be a line that starts with

TITLE My Client

My client is an example there will be the name of the client right now instead of that

So just change that to what you want it to say.

Hope it helps

Read full topic

@Darkning wrote:

try your client class and maybe the EGUI class. Search for the current title and replace it
